description:
This Starbucks had a lot of small flies in the food display counter. They don't serve those to the customers (I believe they're display only) but it's still kind of gross seeing all those flies in the box!

There is very limited seating here.
author: Danielle C.

description:
This matcha drink was kind of a life saver...I was really in need of pick me up because I was having a tough day in the office. 

Rude service, which is sadly getting so common in San Francisco. The drink was good, but the the service was really bad and rude.  I said "Hello", "please" and "thank you"...I got a no response from the guy at the register except for his snarl.

Bad manners.  I understand that San Francisco is getting grosser and grosser, but please...I'm paying 5 dollars for a drink...say thank you.
author: Laksmi V.

description: Why are you getting coffee here? You're in San Francisco. This coffee makes my stomach contract just thinking about it.
author: John P.

description:
This location is best visited by ordering your beverage via the Starbucks App about 10 minutes prior to the time you what to pick it up, the App will say usually 4-6 minutes till it's ready and yet the consistent average is 10 minutes to be able to just walk in and up to the bar and grab your brew.

I only say this is the way to get your fix is because the line can be ten people deep easily and the line slowly moves, plus you then get to wait another ten to fifteen minutes for your drink to be ready.

The waiting area of the store isn't ideal and at any given time someone is blocking the area for milk and sugar, someone is always blocking your path to exit in all directions, either waiting for their drinks or in line to order. The layout of the store doesn't flow as it should for ease of ordering, waiting, picking up and either exiting the store or sitting (in the limited seating that's always occupied all times of the day)!

Great location, bad design!
author: J Austyn B.

description: I came here to study because normally Starbucks has a great atmosphere for that but there were no electrical outlets and the music was way too loud. The food and coffee is also way over priced for the quality you get. I could go to McDonald's and get better coffee. Not coming to this location again. Not worth it.
author: Lara R.

description: I haven't taken a sip yet. The grande latte I got from this Starbucks is only 80% full and the moment I took it I immediately noticed it weighed lighter. It is not the first time. Last time I had to ask to return the coffee. And it looks like there's no improvement at all. So disappointing.
author: Chieh C.

description: This location can get really busy and given it's proximity to City Hall, Twitter & UBER HQ they do well to handle the volume. There is a barista named Andrea, who does well to connect with the regulars. I find myself in here 2 to 3 times per week. It is a Starbucks so the consistency is there.
author: Jay B.

description:
EVERY time i am disappointed, i think to myself, this Starbucks deserves a review.. though i know that no one cares and no one will read it or pay attention to it on the corporate side. That said, today i draw the line.

Once again, i am disappointed. Unfortunately, I have to go to this Starbucks because it is located in the building where i live.. but soon, i will just revert back to my nespresso machine or Pete's down the street. 

Tonight, they closed one earlier than 7pm (locked doors) and therefore, although I ran downstairs to get my daily order, they were closed. 

Yesterday, they made my gouda/egg/bacon without bacon, WITH bacon

The day before, they made my drink order after the order of people who arrived after me. 

The day before that, i was waiting at a register to be helped and a cashier decided to come and work but instead of coming to me while i was at the register waiting to be helped, he went to the next register to help the woman before me! lol - no logic. 

Earlier last week, they had their usual reggaeton channel super loud with commercials (don't get me wrong i love this music) because they prefer to dance and sing than to work

They repeatedly have ONE person on bar, and like two making sandwhiches or cold drinks.. so he/she gets overwhelmed and forgets drink orders all the time

THEY ARE SLOWWWWWWWWWWW so slow its unbearable. I order my orders through the app most of the time, to avoid the crazy line, but even then i request it with three times more advance to avoid waiting. They send me messages saying the drink is ready when i already have been drinking the drink for ten minutes.

THEY ARE A MESS. THEY NEED MANAGERS. i have seen them piss off customers a million times.. sometimes someone will order 4 drinks and they finish them all except one.. so the girl just sits there and waits and waits and waits until she finally speaks up and they finally fix their error and wink at her in apology without apologizing.. 

It's just depressing. i would whip them into shape if i worked in this starbucks. if you don't HAVE go here, DONT! avoid it ! run with your lives!
author: Sara S.

description:
The lone Starbucks in the pit of despair known as the Civic Center.  I ventured down to this store since the rains stopped.  Service is fast and friendly.  I haven't run into any customer service issues.  

Store is relatively clean considering the area.
author: Wendy H.

description: I'm over having bad experiences here. It is a very busy location and I understand that. But the employees should treat the customers better and the managers should hire people that can handle the flow of customers. Today I went in and picked up oatmeal and an iced coffee from the mobile app. When I picked up my order and went to walk out i noticed I didn't have a spoon in the packet they give you for the oatmeal. I went back and spoke with the girl working the mobile orders and asked for a spoon. My hands were completely full and the line was out the door, when she told me to get it from the register. She was just standing there with an attitude. What's more annoying is that they couldn't even get an order for oatmeal right. won't be going to this Starbucks again which sucks cause its right next to my work. I'd rather take the extra time to walk to peets.
author: Kayla F.

description:
This may be the most gross Starbucks I've ever been to. This Starbucks is my closest one... So I've been many times out of sheer laziness and convenience. 

They get my drink wrong 4 out of 5 times. The tall curly haired guy is an absolute mess and does NOT care... His shirt is often inside out and he always has a runny nose. He sticks his hand in the ice machine to scoop the ice with the cup (a big no-no, everyone knows you're to use the scooper). When he makes my drink I feel like throwing it out. 

Today is officially my LAST time at this Starbucks... So disgusting! Who runs this Starbucks? It should really be looked into.
author: Ingrid L.

description:
I wish I could give 0 star. 
This place is going downhill, seriously. Ever since Zayrah left, it seems like people who work here now feel entitled yet are actually incompetent. The chubby barista with a skin problem always either messes up my order or my name. Every time I order a hot white chocolate--whether online or in store, he ends up making a white mocha for me. I always have to tell him that I order a white HOT CHOCOLATE and he would just be giving attitudes and gossiping with his coworkers. And his coworkers gave me evil eyes, saying that "oh I know you'd never mess up an order. Yea, maybe Starbucks online order is inefficient and he is better. 
Whatever. Peet's is around the corner and always offers gift cards at Costco. 
Some people would probably put up with incompetent people, but I won't.
author: Joelle K.

description:
This review is for the friendly baristas but not the corporation. 

Jacky is the sweetest barista. She works hard and gets treated pretty unfairly. I go in this Starbucks everyday and see how the baristas get treated. 

People yell at them, have assisted them and miss treated them and corporate does nothing about it. 

Corporate should find security and protect their employees. Instead of hiding behind miss treated workers!!! I've seen when they have been hit or yelled at for things they had no control over. I saw this man who lost his wallet and he was yelling at the barista. Your wallet your issue! I saw a barista yelled at for a customer bringing a dog! How can they control that?! They can only ask if the animal is a service animal. If people lie what can they do?! Homeless and dirty bathrooms? They can't control the nastiness of the homeless! Corporate should just get rid of the bathroom! Get security before one of your baristas gets killed! 

Be thankful of the staff you have and treat them nice!
author: Evie M.

description: This is the closest location to where I live and the barista just handed my breakfast sandwich to a guy without checking if it's all for the same customer.  After standing for about 3 minutes, the customer realized (or felt bad) that I'm still waiting for my sandwich and checked his bag, asked for my name and apologized that my food was handed over to him.  Like really?  Isn't this basic customer service?
author: Shawn S.

description: Not very friendly service. I paid with my remaining Starbucks balance and the staff member very rudely let me know "you still owe me money" and then when I called him out on it, very loudly and sarcastically told his coworkers in Spanish that I didn't want a name listed on my coffee cup, as if I couldn't hear him.
author: Versace R.

description: Always long line. And it has been twice already that my order was mess up. I have to go back twice to get it fixed. Overall, I like the drink as long as they make the right order. Im good.
author: Crystal T.

description: Awful service. Got my order wrong multiple times and had clueless expressions when I tried to engage them. Just awful
author: M M.

description:
Posted hours say they're open until 8:00, but the doors are locked at 7:45. I guess I don't get any coffee to take with me to work overnight. Seriously not cool. 

On the few times I've been in here before they've been rude, but this is the final straw. Not coming back.
author: Jack P.

description:
K, love ya Starbucks, but this location could use some help. 

First of all, the space has terrible feng shui. The line goes out the door most mornings. When you pick up your drink from the counter, you then have to fight your way through the masses to get back out the door you came in from. 

Also, I was once admonished by an employee to never, ever, ever, under ANY circumstances, just simply ask for the "pink drink", saying that baristas will have no idea what I'm talking about. Really? Cus I'm pretty sure the entire western world knows that it's simply the strawberry/acai refresher with coconut milk (manna from god if you've never tried it). A little politeness goes a long way in this world, friend.
author: Gaby L.

description: This may be a normal Starbucks but Valeria is the best barista I've ever met. She is friendly and courteous, she helps all sorts of impatient costumers, and she does it with a smile. Kudos to Valeria!
author: Claudia G.

description: Whenever I come to Starbucks I always order a chai tea latte. I came to this Starbucks and my drink tasted sour - the milk tasted a little spoilt. That's okay -- I wasn't upset by that - I asked one of the baristas if I could get another one and he was not willing to do so. I threw the drink away.
author: Saadhya S.

description:
Long lines at usual rush hours (morning)  but the staff does a superb job at making drinks quickly. Friendly staff. 
Free WiFi. Lots if indoor seating.
author: Susan C.

description:
I love this Starbucks. I work and live a block away from this location and the morning staff there always makes my day. This review goes out to Jocelyn, Gigi, Lilia, and Katie. They always have a bright smile and greet me with kindness. For the amount of crap they have to deal with in a given day like homeless people begging for water or rude customers, they do an amazing job and seem to churn out orders in a timely fashion and with precision.

Aside from the stellar customer service, their Cold Brew is pretty freaking good. For context, I work at a tech company that serves your typical hipster-ish cold brew and it doesn't taste nearly as good as Starbucks. I rather walk across a street and get my cold brew at Starbucks than just walk a few a step. I've also gone to the Market where they serve Four Barrel cold brew and that is at most alright. 

For what it worth, Starbucks is more than about just coffee. Its a place where people do business, a place where people do work, its a place I love going to when I'm traveling internationally, esp if you're looking for a bathroom. So even though their coffee isn't like Philz or BlueBottle, this is my go to meetup spot.
author: JF K.

description:
#3 of 100 reviews challenge 2016

Pretty standard Starbucks so you know what to expect, however I used to come here when my business' Internet was down. However my laptop needs to be plugged in and on my recent trip here with my colleague, we discovered they covered up all their power outlets. I need juice! Why that changed, I don't know. But bring it back, please! I'll buy a soy vanilla latte from ya folks.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
It's Starbucks, the staff is everything aside from the drinks. The staff are almost always awesome. Friendly and so complying! I work like 1 block away from this location, and this is me and my coworkers' go to Starbucks. Went in here wanting to try one of those secret item drinks- but was hesitated to ask the barista to make it- but the girl (whose name i forgot to get) was so sweet and complying about it, didn't make it complicated nor gave me a hard time, and i just handed over my phone to show her the recipe, ordered, paid, and got my drink! 

Tip: stick to the original items, haha at least from my experience, the secret item menus are eh. lol BTW, i had the thin mint chocolate chip frap.
author: Cindy C.

description: Very crowded at lunch time. A lot of mobile orders. Only 1, sometimes 2 registers. Looks like only 1 person is making drinks most of the time. Still not my longest Starbucks wait though. Second longest maybe.
author: Ryann L.

description: Terrible service....stopped by to get a drink before the opera and apparently Giovanni the barista was really ready to go home and didn't feel like making us any coffee! First he messed up on everyone's order then when I asked him if he can fix my drink he gave me attitude! The man at the cashier was very sweet though - helped everyone out and he was patient!
author: Tamara B.

description: I suddenly wanted to have a mocha from Starbuck! Yes, a mocha from Starbuck... This is my first time at this location!!!! I'm giving them 4 stars for their services but not their drink actually... They were nice and friendly! Attitude toward a customer is one of the most important things that  would help getting my point!!! They got that point.....just because they were willing to remake my mocha with a smile!!! And I like it :))) so they worth 4 stars!!! I am generous haha!!!
author: Chiem E.

description: Nice place but tends to get hot in the afternoon because of the sun and location.
author: William K.

description:
I never review SBUX but this requires it. This location recently underwent a physical renovation (perhaps due to its proximity to Square, Twitter, and Uber HQs). 

The location is understaffed; the AM service is grumpy. Attached is a photo of my drink: my name is Tim (not Brady). I wasn't even asked for my name, so this is a head scratcher. It sat on the counter as I stared at it cooling--no one called the drink out, and it was mislabeled so I had to pick it up, remove the sleeve, check the contents, and ask. Oh, and it wasn't great when I had it.

Mistakes happen, but I watched a barista grunt at 3 different people in a row (including me). One had paid for an extra shot in a Frap. Barista told the order cashier, "Oh, that's what you said. We don't use the word 'affogato' here." So you've just revealed how much of an assembly line system you use, and you were rude to the customer, who was polite. 

Fail.
author: Tim P.

description:
One of my favorite Starbucks, I have been going there every morning for the last year.... Amazing staff super friendly can't start my day without them ....... One time I had a drink that I didn't like they change it for me and also gave me anther free drink for the next day :) 


Love these guys
author: Mohamed M.

description: Starbucks is Starbucks is Starbucks. The thing about this one is BEWARE there are thieves casing this joint and they will get your stuff. Somehow, I'm still not clear on how exactly, they got into my computer bag and stole 2 smaller purses inside without my being aware. And you could tell they were pros with how they dealt with their booty. So if you go here, WATCH OUT!!!
author: Alexis R.

description:
Talk about customer service - this Starbucks has got it goin' on. I was staying at Hotel Whitcomb for three days and this Starbucks kept my mornings energized with my daily order of a latte and cheese danish. 

The first morning, the line was extremely long, but the staff was working hard to keep the orders coming. While it took a good amount of time, my danish was heated to perfection and I had no problems with my latte. Same deal the second morning, except the line was much, much shorter. The order arrived within 75 seconds and once again, no complaints from my end. 

This is a great Starbucks location!
author: Kaif G.

description:
Hey y'all: I was here again several times this year and if anything the staff has MORE to put up with (more menu choices) and a huge flood of people desperate for decent coffee in a really crappy neighborhood. WE NEED YOU!

Do managers read this? 

I spoke to at least one lead or supervisor...Anyways, listen, you guys do a stellar job all things considered; A+ customer service and thanks for your patience.  I know that job ain't easy. 

Coffee was quick, accurate, and fresh. And people did try to fill my special requests. Maybe it helps that I'm also polite. 

Bless, y'all!
author: Ziggy J.

description: This Sbux is a block away from my job so going here is strictly for convenience.  The employees are inconsistent in their customer service, some days they are super nice, some days they are all PMSing and just being total dicks.  I guess I can't blame them for working in a sketchy neighborhood with nonstop crackheads coming in for free water or ice.  This place gets super packed during the morning rush, especially since it's connected to the hotel.  I come here pretty often on my lunch when I just want to sit down and relax.
author: Katie N.

description: Met somebody here. Got a spinach and feta wrap and a blackberry mojito iced tea. Interesting iced tea drinks. Some nice snacks.
author: Denise C.

description: Seriously I don't write too many bad reviews but come on. The staff really not interested to help first of all. I came here to work on my lap top and literally tried every power strip to plug my computer in and after trying about 7 I asked a person working if they worked and he said maybe 1 or 2. And walked away so I said ok I will find the one! None work just FYI so I asked if I could use a connection for my phone and of course, silly me! Those don't work either and she laughed when I asked for one. Didn't even get a chance to order my drink before getting annoyed and leaving. Not petty just irritated when I walk into a nice looking Starbucks I want to be able to vibe out and sip on my coffee and work.
author: Daivya A.

description:
Another super busy Starbucks, but I was still able to redeem my birthday treat!
Cashier gave me a warm smile and wished me a Happy Birthday! =)
author: David W.

description: Convenient location, newly renovated and wireless cell phone charging. Plenty of single stools to do work over free WiFi. This place rocks.
author: Ben G.

description:
Good service.
Line moves quickly even when busy.
Good use of the space. Small but packed with tables and barstools overlooking market street. No couches. Adjacent to Whitcomb Hotel and next to Bart/Muni station. Free wifi (At&T). Gets pretty crowded. Noise level is louder than average. Coffee is ok, not great. Generic, not Gourmet.
I'm only settling to drink coffee here because it's connected to the hotel where I  staying for a congress and this area is kind of sketchy so I don't really want to walk anywhere else. But this is no place to sit and work. Just a spot to stop and grab a quick fix of caffeine when you are desperate and can't function without it! Hey, it happens!
author: Gabriela G.

description:
C'mon, let's face it -- no matter big of a coffee connoisseur you are, you know life would not be the same without Starbucks. And you know that the coffee game would not be the same regardless. And really, if you're anywhere in the world and there no Starbucks wishing a 1 mile radius, you probably shouldn't be hanging out there-- especially at night. 

I frequent this location pretty often. It's close to my work. I mean, a girl's gotta caffeinate. They staff here is super friendly. They recently remodeled it so the interior space really opened up -- tall glass wall lined with countertop seating and two large communal tables inside. It's clean, rustic, and overall has a great coffee shop vibe to it. 

My drink of choice: Tall Blonde w/ a splash of cold Soy.
author: Ellen W.

description: I have been to this Starbucks a few times before and only purchased regular black coffees - this time around I splurged for a Pumpkin Spice Latte. I don't visit Starbucks very often for "fancy coffee", so when I do it's considered a treat for me.   The latte was terrible; unfortunately I hadn't taken a sip until I arrived at my office, about a 1/4 of a mile away.  If I had tasted it while I was at the store, I would have returned it for a plain coffee.  It tasted like sugary milk, was barely warm, and lacked any type of espresso flavor.  It didn't really taste like the pumpkin spice latte's of the past...  I could barely drink it.  Even the addition of some strong filtered coffee at my office couldn't save it.  From now on I'll get my "fancy coffee" fix elsewhere, and only stick to black filtered coffee at Starbucks.
author: Kristine K.

description:
Absolutely one of the slowest Starbucks in the city and no matter what time of day there will be a line.. Veryyyy unfortunate considering it is across the street from my apartment building. 

Would love to see some change!
author: Paisley P.

description:
Every morning, before going to work, i would stop by and buy my coffee here. But the Guy with the eyeglasses is simply RUDE!.. I was just asking for the name of the coffee that it might be available but he answered me "Only on Thanksgiving!, REMEMBER?" (in a rude way) then tapping the cashier's elbow.. 

People go here because of the Name. So next time, if he's there, I will not buy a coffee.. Fortunately, there's another one cafe just within that building.
author: Mei Y.

description:
I noticed a shift, seems like things have improved a bit, so I upgraded to 3 stars.

If you like VERY SLOW SERVICE, this is the place for you. This morning I counted 4 employees plus manager, and the line was moving as slow as ever. A couple of the baristas here are cool and engaging, which helps, but I get the feeling some Starbucks workflow processes aren't being followed. This location often has people living on the fringe, but my rating excludes that. 

Please someone in corporate light a fire under this team and let's get the line moving! It would give me no greater joy than to upgrade the rating.
author: Mark E.

description:
This location USED to be great with nice employees and quick service, but I will never go here again after my experience today.
Yes, it was early morning and the line was typically long going out the back door into the building,  no problem.  However, I was there for 20 minutes from line to getting my simple latte, nothing extra or fancy or special.  20 minutes for coffee!
The girl running the register did not know what she was doing.  I watched her  botch (3) orders before trying to charge me for a green tea latte. 
Everyone was slow and seemed to be standing Around looking for something to do. The only person I felt acknowledged me/ was working her butt off was the barista who kept asking for help and had two different people join her at the bar only to have them be pulled away.
Get it together Starbucks. You are in prime real estate in this town.  I will not be coming back!
author: Dangerous T.

description: Place has fairly friendly staff, it is just the homeless that makes this place bad.
author: M C.

description: What i like from this starbucks is the decoration. They have the new style, big table so that people will sit around, time for real socialize!!! The roof is pretty with all the pictures in glass. You can sit inside and look people walking on the street. When i came, there were two staffs and they are both very friendly and energetic. So... What are you waiting for? Come here for a lazy day!!!
author: Angie N.

description: It never fails that I experience some type of BS when I get coffee. I lasted a picture of damn near half of My coffee missing before I was able to take a sip. The blonde chick making my drink was a capital B talking about "oh well" when her coworker told her my story, although the young man Did offer me a free drink in compensation he was very apathetic and oookkkkkkkkkk? With me. For most of the employees here you can tell they got comfortable with where they are because their noncaring & non-existent customer service skills bother the living Crap out of me. My first time there they let me stand in front of a closed registry and WAITEDfor me to ask if there's a bell to ring so I can get help all while making eye contact not only with me but their coworkers while finishing morning duties. Idk why I come here..... they suck.
author: nichol c.

description: Since all the old employees have left and most of the new ones the new manager has hired The customer service and quality of the brewed coffee as well as the cleanliness has gone down by 70% the store is filthy when I go in and the customer service is just not there anymore.The manager needs to have  Demitri & Ryan train the new employees. The two that were working this morning at 8:AM have no personality at all. There was no Good morning no thank you just dead air. It's a sham.
author: Travis A.

description:
I used to work in the building and went back the other day.  The employees were all different and the line was extremely long for being almost 10:30 AM.  I don't know, maybe it's the holiday drinks that made the line so long.  Wondering if Lily still works here, because the customer service did not seem up to par as it was before.

The four stars is mostly for what this Starbucks location was before...
author: V A.

description: So as an aficionado of all things Starbuck in SF and the Peninsula, I want to say that tonight I met the winner of the World's Worst Barista award. The fat guy with the bad complexion at Fox Plaza. Distracted, rude, arguing with the customer about how he made my drink, clearly unhappy working there, generally nasty.  Ugh.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
This is a guest review from Momma D. 

Shortly after waking me up at 6:30 on saturday morning, my mom suggested we quickly grab coffee at Starbucks. After leaving Starbucks, my mom opined the following, and asked me to put it on Yelp. Now that she has left SFO, I am putting it up.

My Mom: ".... Where... where is the vanilla powder? MY Starbucks has vanilla powder and cinnamon and nutmeg. You should talk to them about that. WHAT KIND OF STARBUCKS IS THIS?"

I replied with some quip about how dare the Starbucks near the Tenderloin not have vanilla, how could they etc. Then we discussed the social situation near my dorm and I reminded her why I carry pepper spray and she told me to stop running around the city at 1:30am looking for burritos. 

Man, I love my mom.
author: Emily D.

description: This is my first ever review because I just had to say something. The glass case where all of the sweet breads are kept was filled with flies and gnats! I told the employee and she ignored me. BEWARE!
author: Marc P.

description: I'm a big fan. The line can be terrible in the morning- but hey, it IS starbucks in SF before 10 am. There's going to be a big line just about everywhere. Even so, the staff is friendly and remember my drink. The redesign of the store makes much more sense and has a better airy feel to it.
author: Christina M.

description:
Usually the only time I stop at this Starbucks is if I'm waiting for a friend to get off BART or doing some work after hitting up the library.

This Starbucks is quite small. No bathroom. Very limited seating. However, the lady that's usually at the cashier counter to take my order is very sweet and lovely. She's older and reminds of a grandma.

It's always loud and crowded here which is one thing I don't like. The tables are super cramped and people just don't understand the concept of not blocking the door or not crowding people who are sitting down.

There is also usually a lot of things going on outside the storefront. It's right next to the BART/MUNI and bus stop. So more often then not there will be cops in the area.

Like I said, not my favorite Starbucks to go to, but it'll do.

Until next time, happy caffeine hunting!
author: Valerie A.

description: Always come here at least once a week before work and the staff here are very efficient. I always try go get in line before 8:20 a.m. when the line is short (for some reason the morning rush comes in between 8:20 and 8:30). The morning baristas are an energetic bunch and nice. The space is fairly small and there's limited seats - they're usually filled when I come in. Nonetheless they keep up the store clean and tidy. Extra points for the location.
author: Jamey P.

description:
This store was a mess when I stopped by this afternoon.  Literally.  There was trash strewn everywhere, on thecounters and on the floor.  Come on!  It couldn't have been that busy all day keeping the staff from picking up.

Since I was hankering for something cold, I ordered a java chip frap and was not very happy with it.  It was icy with no coffee flavor.  What a waste of money.  I am done with Starbucks.  (At least until the next time I find myself in the middle of nowhere and need the restroom.)
author: Jeannette W.

description: Clean enough and the brewed coffee was fresh versus sitting there for more than the 30 minutes. First pit stop of three Starbucks on our pre-lion king adventure (I know.. weird)
author: Vicky T.

description: Shout-out to this Starbucks for having free wireless charging stations. We live in the future. Also featuring nice employees who kindly cleaned up after me when I knocked an entire latte on the floor, and a clean bathroom. High marks all around.
author: vanessa r.

description:
Your average downtown, busy-location Starbucks.  Always has a line but at least the staff is quick, efficient, and get's your order correct.

While Pete's is better in the my book as for chain coffee, this Starbucks at least get's it right for a Starbucks experience.
author: Chris R.

description:
Terrible,  terrible, terrible.... I understand drinks taking awhile during peak hours but when there are more staff working than are people in line when  enter i assume i will be in and out fairly quick. I ordered two frappacino and one triple espresso at @1pm. Both fraps i wanted exactly the same flavor, size, etc. There were two ladies working the bar, both African Amer. The one who made my espresso had dark hair and was very pretty, quick, friendly, and tidy. She had my espresso to me in under two mins. As for the fraps. The first one got to me @7 mins after the espresso and the lady making it had a burgundy dye job and an expressionless face. Zero personality and soooooooooooo slooooooooow!!!!!???? Two grandes can be made together FYI, i worked at Starbucks a ways back. On top of it all they were the ONLY two blended drinks made while i waited. She poured milk into cup for #1 then held still while another staff spoke, two mins later she poured milk into blender, pause half a min to respond, pump in sauce, ten sec pause to listen, puts dow the blender to speak, looks at blender in confusion adds ice. Stops to thunk, adds cookie crumble, lid and blend. A full min of chut chat ensues, removes lid, washes lid, pours ONLY ONE DRINK OMFG.. stops, washes blender puts away. Chats a few beats, turns reads cup ignores the extra whip request, hands me beverage. Thinking she is clearly stoned i remind her there are two. Second drink a nearly identical process,  in fact, my brother finished his drink before i received mine. Wow.

This was roughly two weeks ago on a Tuesday @ 1pm. I worked at a starbucks for over a year and i know about how long these drinks "should" take.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Lately, the pastry case has been sprinkled with little flies so I have not gotten a warmed morning bun nor a banana nut bread. I tried to get a turkey bacon sandwhich this am but they said that don't have (not sure if that means their out or item is discontinued).

Neverthelss, I enjoy my passion-tea lemonades, vanilla lates (hot & cold), pepermint mochas and passion teas.
author: Nneka G.

description:
Starbucks @ Fox Plaza...

I must say, this Starbucks as actually not bad which is why I wanted to give this store 3 stars, but there's something that stands out about this location.  After entering the door (it's only obvious, it's Starbucks, they train their employees to be robotic) the store was immaculate, Super clean and the seating area inside packed with students on their notebooks.  

But what gave this store this 4th star was the sense of community.  Customer after customers, it was first name basis and a quick recap on their last conversation.  As customers trickled in a out of the store, the employees happily had conversation with each other while doing their daily tasks.  There's nothing more than wanting to be wanted and this store  truly gave me that feeling.  The feeling of hanging out at your local coffee house and not just another Starbucks.

Thanks Erica and Lily! You guys are awesome!
author: Edrian D.

description:
I can't believe I've never written a review about this place! I'm here all the time because I work right across the street. Also, this Starbucks location helped bring me to my Gold Card status. :)

Lily is the absolute best. She's so friendly and bubbly and can make your day feel so much better.

There's another guy barista here who I think is pretty awesome too. Too bad I don't know his name, but when I came in last week, he did notice that I got a completely new hairstyle. :)

I will go out of my way to come to this Starbucks over the others in the area. Granted, there are lots of weirdos who are sitting on the chairs outside, but once you get past them and into Starbucks, you'll be alright.
author: Melissa D.

description: 29 Nov 13 Walked in this hot Friday afternoon around 2 pm for a venti sweet iced coffee w light ice & got presented with the worst ice coffee drink ever. The drink was only half filled with some watery ice cubes, not sweet, & the condiment bar was a MESS, pity considering the shop was slow. Had to get a refund & the shift supervisor offered to Toss the drink in the bin instead of bothering to remake it. Impolite & SLOPPY!
author: Julian I.

description:
The line at this place gets SO LONG.  Do not let is discourage you, these power baristas will get your drink to you in no time.  I have never seen a line move that fast.  Impressive.

Sometimes they are nice, sometimes not so much.  Overall an ok experience, but don't expect to be able to get a seat, with minimal seating and extreme business and empty table is hard to come by.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Writing this review for that cute barista(?) with short hair who let me use the bathroom,  you da real MVP.

Got the choco croissant and got it heated which was cool, but then saw that they sold madeleines and asked if I could get it heated. The guy told me he couldn't when from the look of their heating device he probably could have.  Not a big deal but it was a letdown all the same. 

I might come back I guess.
author: Vayne K.

description: Not the Starbucks experience you normally want
author: Robert L.

description:
Filipino Barista at Fox Plaza Starbucks:

Your condescending attitude made me decide to not set foot at your store again. Your lack of courtesy and deference to me as a customer really turns me off. And your store was my to-go Starbucks in the Civic Center area.

You want specifics? Well, do not smirk when I ask you if "Apple Spice" is a hot chocolate flavor.  On several occasions you have given me attitude like I was bothering you for your time. Is it because we came here on the same boat?! I am Pinay, too.

Guess what?! I just added $50 to my Starbucks card this morning and I am sure that at least a couple of family members will give me more Starbucks cards as present.

And guess what? I will not be spending them at your store as long as you are around.

Tell your bosses they should give you a nice fat bonus for great customer service skills.

Better yet, take some cultural classes this coming Spring.  I am sure it is available at City College.
author: Leah E.

description: Caffeine!! Conveniently located and surprisingly, this location's line is never long when I stop by (usually 3 4 pm?) Standard Starbucks quality you can expect and I think it makes a great breathing spot for those of us who work nearby!
author: Victor K.

description:
Oh star bucks, you make my wildest ambitions and dreams come true. 

Thank you for your innovation of creating such brilliant master pieces such as the venti soy caramel macchiato. How do you do it? Double shot espresso machine.

and your friendly baristas that keep me entertained from the real world of  nefarious pee-smelling wanderers and 50 cent pan-handlers.
author: Fat C.

description: 7am, Thursday morning. They're out of almost all foods, no napkins, no stirrers, two staff behind the counter. Long line, but it looks like all you can get is coffee, black.
author: Anna L. C.

description: I visited this location today around 12:30p after purchasing the deal on groupon. Their was almost an entirely different staff from who I'm used to seeing and they were quick! There was a long line and I had 20 mins left on my break. Normally I wouldn't bother, knowing that it wouldn't be enough time. But today I was pleasantly surprised with the service! The girl on bar who had brown hair with highlights had forgotten an ingredient in my drink, quickly apologized and said she would remake it! I didn't wait more than a couple mins for her to do so and it was delicious! I'm adding two stars for her service alone!
author: Angela B.

description:
This is one of my fave starbucks, and happily it's a stone's throw from my work.  The folks in there are always really nice, friendly and pleasant to interact with. 

Thanks guys!
author: Amy M.

description: This Starbucks is slow.  Great location near the civil center, but be prepared to wait for you coffee for a while.  Bring a book and meditate.
author: Albert S.

description:
I could have sworn I Yelped about this location before, especially since I come here practically everyday.  Great service and coffee.  Lily is phenominal.  She knows virtually every customers order by heart.  It really brightens up my morning when the staff know you by name and order.

I must admit that I ventured to Martha's down the block a few times, but there's just no comparison.  My coworkers received salty coffee from them on multiple occasions.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Great service!

Lily is awesome.  She knows me and my drink and has it set up by the time I'm at the register.  Great way to start my morning :-)
author: Scott F.

description:
So... I am a Starbucks addict. This is for sure.

However, since going to this spot. I have cooled off.

I ordered the "new" Soy Vanilla Roobis Latte and a Blueberry Oat Bar. Tell me why within one hour I felt not right. I managed to be alright for the remaining 2-3 hours while attempting to continue my apartment hunt. And eventually was forced to head back home to Oakland after feeling worse and worse.

Within an hour of getting home. I was sick... very very sick. With the worse food poisoning that I have encountered. I don't know what caused it, but it was horrible and definitely a turn off from this place. Even upon walking in, it smelled dirty and musky. On top of that, the cashier who handled my pastry wasn't wearing gloves. That should have been a sign. Doh!

After stopping by a Starbucks in another location weeks later. I saw the infamous Blueberry Oat Bar. And was disappointed to see that it was a lot brighter, and crispier than the one I ate. The one I ate, was severely darker and flatter. Now I'm sure it was the Blueberry Oat Bar. So for all you who are like me when thinking "Blueberry Oat Bar... can't really go wrong with that!" False. Be weary, you don't know the damage it can do. Oh man...
author: Natasha S.

description: I appreciate the Asian guy who made my drink this morning. I'm 7 months pregnant and needed to know exactly how many caffeine milligrams were in the skinny vanilla latte. He instantly gave me an answer (75 milligrams), and then went on to explain how many were in the decaf (5-10 milligrams). Very much appreciated at 5:45am!! I wish I would have been awake enough to remember his name, but this guy deserves some acknowledgement. Most of the baristas act as if you have to pay them for information such as this. Good job Starbucks! Hire more people like that and I'll keep coming back!
author: Natalie J.

description:
I take back what I said about Starbucks. That guy still sucks, but he disappeared so maybe Starbucks fired him for being so condescending. Or maybe they realized he's bad for business.

I've been back a few times on my gift card. The friendly customer service, tempting dessert case full of treats, and decent coffee works for me. It's close to my school too, so it's very convenient and efficient. This is my study break spot. For that purpose, it's perfectly adequate.
author: Cathy S.

description: The Sunday crew sucks. Hella Greedy and Roberto had a fucken attitude after the fact he got my order wrong.
author: Perry A.

description:
I went to this place @ 6:00am Friday the 28th to get strong coffee before my workout. I don't care about the taste, sugar and cream were created for that purpose. I ended getting 2 of the venti or whatever the word is for medium. One before and one after my workout. Now this is totally gross, but I judge a coffee by when I have to go to the bathroom after I drink it. After this nada, nothing, no action downstairs. So I pronounce this coffee as a timid offering, at least that day.

Maybe they had a bad day but I cant risk lashing out at somebody because my coffee was weak lolz..

The doorman or desk guy from the hotel next door came in and started signing and grooving with 2 older ladies  to the tunes of AL Jolson. At 6:00 AM! I cannot decide if that is good or bad, but I am not the type of wimpy yelper who yelps about things that the Establishment has no control over.

I will say that they have one of the hottest guys I have seen working the register and for that purpose alone I will gladly furnish one star.

If this is you hit me up hahahah.

The service was great for 6:00 AM, quiet, competent and not over friendly,
author: Sean C.

description:
This location is awkwardly shaped (very narrow) and in the ghetto. I walked there anyway and was dismayed that they have an extremely, extremely small selection of their whole bean coffees. They don't even have them out on the floor for people to look at (all other Starbucks do, is this location so ghetto they are afraid people will walk out with the whole stash?) and they didn't carry a staple Starbucks coffee: Komodo dragon. I had to walk another 20 blocks in the cold/dark to get my pound of coffee (and they wouldn't even call there to see if the other store carried my coffee first).

The barista did offer me another kind of coffee, but it wasn't even another Asian Pacific coffee...in fact he really didn't seem to know anything about their coffees at all. I don't recommend it if you want to browse the whole bean coffees or actually want to buy some. I saw no more than 4 kinds in their cupboard.

Edit: I had to take off 1 star after I read reviews from people stating there was another Starbucks down the street. The barista directed me to a Starbucks some 15 minutes away on foot each way at night time, stating it was the closest. Now I'm just pissed. :/
author: Love X.

description: Average, but a nice stop on the way to the Civic Center Farmer's market.
author: Tina F.

description: Lily is the BEST!!!!! she knows my name, knows my drink, and is uber friendly! what more can you ask for first thing in the morning?!
author: Ann T.

description: The staff here is outstanding.  Sometimes the folks that goes here could get pretty demanding and that's their right, but the staff handles it quite well.  I've seen a few unhappy folks a few times. Not quite a place to sit and relax so really it deserves three stars, but again the staff takes it up a notch to four stars.
author: Nixon L.

description: Avoiding this place like the plague if I can after they messed up my order.   Came here to get my usual...double chocolate chip frap because I've pretty much trying to reduce my caffeine intake while I'm pregnant.  I got tired of the vanilla and strawberry cream fraps.  The server, some blonde dude looked so out of it, I repeated my order...double chocolate chip frap.  What did he end up giving me?!?!?! A java chip frap. WTF!  How is this even close to what I stated...TWICE.  One sip of this drink and i was pissed.  I asked the barista what the hell was this to find out what it was...luckily the barista apologized and gave me a coupon for a free drink...but I'm never coming back to this location to order a drink.    Most of the other baristas are cool, but not that blonde dude.
author: Lisa W.

description: If you like your Starbucks chock full o people watchin, then this is the place to go! Today for example, this location included a woman talking to herself, an extra large parrot, and a man with one leg and no teeth. It was awesome. Plus, despite the long lines, the staff works quickly and are very friendly.
author: Lissa K.

description: Typical for a downtown area Starbucks. Besides, SF has tons of them
author: Ebony B.

description: House coffee is weak but everything else is great!  Watch out for beggars & purse-snatchers when it's exceptionally busy in the mornings.
author: L T.

description:
If it wasn't for the fact that my mom regularly adds money to my Starbuck's card for birthdays and holidays, I would surely have collapsed from starvation and thirst long ago. Those days when I'm at work, broke, without even a pb&j sandwich to my name, my Starbuck's card provides me with enough sustenance to carry on through my workday. 

That being said, the Fox Plaza Starbuck's is my go-to stand. It is less chaotic than the one across the street and the staff is always very friendly. There always seems to be enough seats, probably because the regulars generally take their provisions back upstairs to their Fox Plaza offices. Other than that, what can I say? It's Starbuck's, you know what to expect.
author: Lisa W.

description: Asked for extra hot for my peppermint mocha, and it was luke warm.  I hate that!  Do what your customers ask for!
author: Nancy S.

description:
Hard to find. Coming from Polk street, you have to enter into Fox Plaza walk into what looks like and actually is a residential apartment complex. From Markey st. It's across from Anderson Bakery. No other Starbucksbear this vacinity. Small. Only 4tables or so to work/study hear.

Baristas not exceptional here. Slow. 

Don't get their Pumpkin Spice latte. It's exceptionally & unbearably sweet. Gross!
author: Keiko C.

description:
Sometimes I wonder, how much money have I given Starbucks in the last 10 years that I have been patronising them? It must be about 8 trillion dollars. I don't get SF'ers complaining about Starbucks because if you go to say, NYC, their invasion is much, much worse. Even the ghetto ass neighborhood my NYC family lives in (135th and Broadway) recently got their McDonald's replaced by a Starbucks. And trust me, they love it. Progress!! They can be just like white people now! Yes! 

Anyway, while I looooved Starbucks in high school, I have grown up just a little bit and find their coffee barely drinkable these days, especially when you become a west coast girl and start to worship at the altar of Peet's. Everything changes, however, when one starts spending their work week in No Man's Land. A land of donut shop coffee on every corner, which works when it's 4 in the morning but does not work when you have an incredibly tedious job that would make someone on a speed bender pass out. 

And so, my friends, we must come to Starbucks. To this one. Service is pretty good and they have this one dude in the mornings who makes sculptures out of all of the empty soy milk containers that I always try to grab a camera phone picture of. He's super sassy and is always working on his craft. I love it! They don't get weird when you don't use their lingo and as usual, everything tastes exactly the same as the Starbucks on Fillmore, the Starbucks in JFK, the Starbucks in London, the Starbucks in Garden State Plaza, etc.
author: Maria D.

description:
Everyone knows Starbucks is supposed to be evil.  I know I know!

But the convenience- My gawd the convenience!

People listen, its an eight story elevator ride down to heavenly, warm, caffeine injected consistency.  Do you hear me?  CONSISTENCY.  

And that is why i give the Starbucks in the lobby of my building four stars.  The rare overlooked quality of Consistency.  

Say it with me, "Consistency"
author: R M.

description: I've had  better service at other locations. The line is always long at this one. Expect to wait in line for 10-15 minutes to get coffee.
author: C B.

description: Standard Starbucks.  The coffee is strong, and over-roasted.  I'm typically not that big a fan of Starbuck's, but this one is next to my work shuttle pick-up location.  I've always had a pretty positive experience with the staff here.  It gets really busy here, so they get a bonus star for having remotely good service.  They can really crank those drinks out!
author: Ted G.

description: Slow and bad service. I go here every morning (I live in the building, fox plaza) and there is always a grummpy attitude (not morning people?) never ask my name nor wish me a good day. What is going on?! Im obviously not the only one, so not taking it personally, but still.....
author: M F.

description: I'm usually here a couple times a week at least. Gotta have the morning coffee right? Pretty much what you would expect from a Starbucks. The place is a generous size with seating available. The staff is also very friendly and usually quick. Not really a bad thing since its expected, but this place is very busy in the morning with the line out of the store.
author: Ajay K.

description: Service is  slow and crappy and the workers always have attitudes like all the time. I only come here because it's close to work and it's Starbucks. Chain coffee shops don't bother me when I can always get the same thing all the time regardless of whose working.
author: Sophie P.

description: always friendly staff and great location!  This is my favorite Starbucks! love the marshmellow treats too!!!
author: Emily L.

description:
Like a lot of San Franciscans, I really try to support the local mom and pop's. Sometimes, like today, I was out of coffee at home. Headed out with the pooch, my quest for coffee begins.

With my 4.5 pound Chihuahua tucked under my arm, I go in. The (sort of) hipsters behind the counter look at me -- the guy asks "Is your dog a service animal"? I'm thinking, Iraq? 

Then I hear it..."NO DOGS ALLOWED!" The chick makes some weird face, and says "allergies". 

What really burns my beans, is that I have been in there a few times, with my dog. I mention that this has never been a problem, and ask for their names. The chick says Amber, the dude says "we sort of don't give out names".

Would Amber sneeze if I didn't have the dog -- I'm, basically covered in dog hair. If I wanted to make a service inquiry, or complain -- would the dude then give me his name? Well, that is what I wanted to do.

Totally lame!
author: Kevin M.

description:
I'll start my review like most of the others:

"Yeah.... I know it's Starbucks"......

This place is beyond convenient for me, since I live in the building.  The people there know most of the regulars and what they drink, to the point of being nearly comical.  

This location is always busy, yet you never need to wait very long in line.  Often, my drink is ready by the time I get to the register to pay.

If I were smart, and less lazy, I'd make my own coffee upstairs, but since I am lazy, (and I guess not financially smart) I get my morning fix here.  

Everyone is friendly, and it makes the crazy ass rent I pay to live here a bit easier to swallow.
author: King O.

description: Normally the service is great, fast and accurate. But one bad Apple can ruin the bunch. I went in twice one day and this one server was rude on and off the cashier. Don't get it twisted! You r not the coffee god.
author: Tani R.

description:
Yes, I know it's Starbucks.
I love a Venti 2 Bag Awake Tea for the following:

When I can't muster up the strength to walk over to Blue Bottle it does the trick.

When I know I will bounce off the walls if I have another Latte'

They are in my building!!!!

Open early open late.

Yummy blueberry scones

You can get it any where and it tastes the same.

ONLY $1.75!!!!!!!!
author: Douggers M.

description:
Plus:
-Nice staff
-they get your order quick even when the line is long it seems to pass by quickly.
-right next to Post Office
-clean bathrooms

Minus:
-pan handling area
-can have quite long lines on morning rush coffees and lunch brakes as well due to it's epicenter locations to nearby large establishment/businesses surrounding it.
- not too much inside seating so it's often full / too occupied.
-average size nothing extra ordinary


I come here during late lunches and late morning start at my old job.
still find the people always perky in attitude and friendly which is why I chose to come by whenever I'm near that area.
author: Ateh M.

description: I waited what 10 minutes for a barrister to go out and get toilet paper at 11: 00 in the morning. Hello! Supplies! Who forgot the TP? Crossing eyes, fingers, knees! Hello?
author: Timothy H.

description: Great staff that's always chill even when it's crowded w/ tourists leaving the hotel.  They know the regulars by name and orders.
author: Kim K.

description: i'm here every weekday.  the staff here is friendly, and remembers everybody who goes there regularly.  hardly any wait cause they know just what i want and how i want it.
author: Karen L.

description:
The staff are incredibly friendly and the layout is much better than the Hotel Whitcomb branch 2 blocks away (very important for me as I use a wheelchair.)

A colleague told me "they teach them at Starbucks school" to memorize customer names, which somewhat dampened my pleasure at being greeted by name every day.

You can't really teach (or fake) friendliness, though, and I'm still wasting a lot of cash here on grande iced coffees with milk. 

Sweetened.
author: Blaine A.

description: Couldn't even get a giftcard order right - I ended up gifting my employee with an empty giftcard for which I had paid $25. Another Starbucks location was gracious enough to try and make it right, but how hard is it to get a giftcard properly charged? Mistakes happen, but they happen a lot at this store and I stop in on my morning commute so I don't have time to wait while they fix errors. Too bad, it is so much more convenient than the other locations nearby.
author: B. A.

description: I am a Starbucks connoisseur, I know it's not PC to say but I love me some Starbucks.   I even have a friggi'n Starbucks gold card, that's how addicted I am to this sugary crap.  That being said, no matter what Starbucks I find myself in I always remark that they are no where NEAR as good as this location.  Lilly and the rest of her staff always remember my name and drink order and everyone is really sweet.  Even at their busiest (And I mean line out the door busy) they move quickly and still provide excellent customer service.  Props to them for having a compost bin and hippy type snacks available!
author: Ruth S.

description: I usually go to this location because its only a block from my job, but its not really worth it. I usually wait in line for about 10 min. Always busy . The inside is clean , the outside a diff. Story. The usual homeless asking for change, its rite in front of bart so that's another reason for all the traffic. Overall if you just want good coffee you may want to go somewhere else. Rite around the corner is a cafe called " m cafe" obviously no Starbucks but still great coffee its clean and you don't wait forever. Also try Starbucks butter croissant, ask them to warm it up . It's a butter party in your mouth ( worth the wait )
author: Ashley G.

description: This Starbucks is right on the street in the Fox Plaza apartment building, where a mighty theatre once stood.  The crew was very nice to me.  There's a combination lock on the restroom, and despite its heavily trafficked location, it's remarkably clean.
author: David D.

description: This is my favorite Starbucks. The staff is really great.. They always remember me and I see how many other clients they remember. Many times they know what you like to drink and are always cheerful.. What a great place to visit. I love Starbucks.. But especially love this one.
author: Jacob R.

description:
One day I thought I'd try this Starbucks hoping to get faster service. I was wrong. I believe most of the people in line probably work in the building and come here because it's close. Well, I came in here thinking since it's larger than the one down the street it might have more people working. I was wrong. They had only two people working the whole time. One guy making drinks and one guy taking drinks. I waited for a while and was frustrated and left. I will never go here again. 

The other Starbucks down the street is tinier, but they have one (sometimes two) person taking the order, two registers (sometimes) taking payments, and one or two people making drinks. The manager of the store needs to know the customers and have many people in the morning and cut back in the evening.
author: Jen C.

description: Lily, the store manager, is effervescent and runs a good ship! My order is always ready super quick, even when the line is out the door. This location has turned me into a Starbucks addict.
author: Mia L.

description: The employees working were more concerned about the not letting the last person in line use the bathroom at closing rather than cleaning up their store which was so filthy and disgusting. Coffee cups, food and their wrappers were all over the tables and floor and god only knows what else. Very rude employees, ESPECIALLY the guy with glasses. As soon as it turned 7:30 glasses guy was going around kicking everybody out and was not friendly about it. The woman working told my boyfriend that everyone needs to leave for "security" reasons. What happened to the technical 10 minute grace period that I've been told that Starbucks has for customers? I understand that the employees want to go home but give me a break one person has been waiting to use the bathroom long before the clock turned to closing time, I think that the extra minute spent in the store is not that life threatening.  I've never been so poorly treated at a Starbucks than I was at this location. I was with three other people and they were all just as equally upset with the customer service. This location should look into hiring some new staff because the two people we dealt with should not be working in a customer service environment. I wish I would have looked at their name tags because I would really love to name drop right now!  Just know that you suck!
author: Ashley M.

description: The staff at this Starbucks truly is exceptional.  I make it a point to arrange my schedule so I can come to this store and even choose this Starbucks over other cafes because of the great staff.  Lily, one of the shift managers, is an absolute gem.  She is so welcoming to everyone who enters the store and really attempts to remember people.  I have seen her brighten the day of many customers.  The staff here seems to be particularly efficient at processing orders, too, and always works hard and fast with a smile.  Truly the best Starbucks experience I've had!
author: Rochelle G.

description: This is a above-average, comfortable Starbucks in a below-average location.  BUT the employees are phenomenal!  They are good at handling long lines efficiently, and keeping the riffraff to a minimum, which is especially impressive, considering the nature of mid-market.
author: Jaime R.

description:
oh my gosh. worst. starbucks. ever.

my friends work at the apple store downtown, so im always there to visit and sometimes, when we want to get coffee, this is where wed go (not anymore, thank you peets in the basement of the new SF mall). 

i remember one specific time when we waded though all the bum piss on the sidewalk and made inside. the windows were all steamed up and it smelled like the mens locker room. there was no line, just people all over the place (chaos). my friend and i looked at each other and said, "lets go to the starbucks across the street", and ive NEVER gone back there since.

yes, there actually is one, a much NICER one across the street.

seriously, this starbucks is the WORST ive ever been in. i have seen bums roll thier shopping carts into the place and camp out. the service is bad (everyone is so apathetic and blah. i used to work at starbucks, so i know how it is...but, still. come ON!), my drinks were more often than not messed up and its DISGUSTING.

thank god for peets.
author: Ameigh F.

description: I love the customer service there. A particular few make me feel welcomed that is sincere as soon as I walk in the door.
author: David L.

description: Honestly, I hear that Starbucks is a great place to work, but I feel awful drinking corporate coffee. I avoid the place as a rule. Still, I'm right next door to this particular Starbucks every day. The convenience has me stopping by on occasion, and the folks there are very nice. 1 star for the crew, 1 star for convenience, and 1 star for the yummy pumpkin latte. Minus 2 stars for being corporate and driving quaint neighborhood shops out of business.
author: David H.

description: I love this location, the staff is fantastic! I lived in the building before, and it was always nice to come downstairs and have them know what I want. There is always a bit of sketch clientele (well and some that don't buy anything), but security usually gets rid of them fairly quick.
author: Andrew B.

description: This star-bucks attracts an incredibly diverse clientele. Wanna get wired? try their iced-coffee. dude.
author: Chris C.
